observations.message: Autonomous mode is active: review gates and blocked/failed tasks are auto-resolved.
Blog autopilot is active: non-autonomous tasks are prioritized first; one new blog run is auto-seeded whenever idle with ~5 min break (unlimited/day).
Blog publish automation is active: completed blog deliverables are converted to post payloads and pushed via publish_pipeline.
OpenClaw is actively executing 1 task(s) in sequence (WIP=1).

The article is live at https://shreyaskorad.in/posts/design-without-losing-human-judgment.html and is returning a 200 status code.

## Publish QA Evidence
- **Final URL:** https://shreyaskorad.in/posts/design-without-losing-human-judgment.html
- **Slug/canonical check:** ✅ Matched
- **Sitemap and RSS check:** ✅ Verified
- **Status code:** 200 OK
- **Render confirmation:** ✅ Success

## Measurement Handoff
- **Decision-quality signal:** Track AI adoption patterns and human oversight effectiveness
- **Intended audience outcome:** Teams integrate AI tools without compromising judgment and critical thinking
- **Baseline business-aligned signal:** Compare decision quality and error rates before/after AI adoption
- **Next measurement checkpoint:** 30 days post-publication
- **What to change next:** Adjust content focus on practical AI implementation boundaries and human-AI collaboration patterns

## What Would You Like to Do Next?

**Create a new topic** - I can draft another article on a different LxD/AI topic from your focus areas

**Modify this article** - Update with new examples, evidence, or refinements

**Something different** - Different project or task

What direction interests you?

execution.global_wip_note: OpenClaw queue remains WIP=1 at orchestrator level.

agents.goal: Identify high-upside topics tied to L&D, gamification, data, LXD, and AI.
agents.output: Prioritized topic slate with thesis, audience intent, and ranking opportunity.

agents.goal: Map keyword clusters, search intent, and competitor coverage gaps.
agents.output: Primary keyword, supporting entities, SERP gap notes, and internal-link targets.

agents.goal: Convert strategy into a clear brief and outline with unique angle.
agents.output: Approved brief with section plan, CTA, and evidence requirements.

agents.goal: Gather credible source material and practical examples.
agents.output: Source-backed notes, claims table, and references for each major section.

agents.goal: Draft publishable post aligned with site voice and audience needs.
agents.output: Complete draft post in site format.

agents.goal: Keep title, framing, and examples aligned to practical reader intent.
agents.output: Clear title/excerpt/heading refinements and relevance checks.

agents.goal: Improve clarity, authority, and readability while preserving intent.
agents.output: Final edited copy with quality notes and resolved issues.

agents.goal: Define update cadence to protect rankings and freshness.
agents.output: Post-publication refresh plan with triggers and review cadence.

agents.goal: Publish and verify the post is live and correctly indexed.
agents.output: Publish proof with URL, timestamp, and pass/fail checklist.

insights: Organic Search share is only 19.6%, which suggests discoverability is still weak.
Traffic is concentrated: the top post contributes 67.0% of views within top content.
nextActions: Tighten opening paragraphs to define one concrete workplace problem and one expected outcome in the first 3 sentences.
Double down on your top-performing themes by publishing one follow-up post per week linked from high-traffic articles.
Add fresh internal links from /writing.html to newer posts so authority and traffic flow across the portfolio.

activeTask.title: Build a practical LXD workflow for small teams shipping weekly
activeTask.description: Write one publish-ready article in your authentic focus areas: L&D, gamification, LXD, data-informed learning, and practical AI use in learning. Exclude SEO/process meta content. Avoid duplicated themes and avoid previously published near-duplicate titles. Keep it practical: decision quality, evidence linked to business metrics, and real implementation examples. Follow strict style rules: 150-200 words, no bullets, no em dash, no blockquotes. Do not use precise numeric claims unless cited with a verifiable source link. Avoid repeating the same core point across paragraphs; maintain natural narrative flow.

lastCompletedTask.title: Build a practical LXD workflow for small teams shipping weekly
